intro: Hippeastrum pallidum, commonly known as the white hurricane lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in late summer or early autumn. The plant produces large, showy blooms that can reach up to 10 inches in diameter, making it a popular ornamental species. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, typically emerging from a bulbous base. Hippeastrum pallidum is relatively easy to cultivate and thrives in well-drained soil with plenty of sunlight.
